entities.description: The proportion of the population exhibiting characteristics of interest (e.g., substance use).
A specific demographic or geographic area of study within the population.
An estimate of the number of individuals in the population exhibiting the characteristic of interest.
A method or formula used to calculate estimates, such as prevalence rates.
The error caused by the process of sampling rather than conducting a complete census.
A measure used to identify unreliable estimates and test for statistical significance.
A variable representing the analysis weight for sample units.
A variable defined as 1 if a condition is met (e.g., being in a specific domain) and 0 otherwise.
A sampling method allowing estimation of sampling error and reducing sampling error.

relationships.description: Associates a domain with its respective prevalence rate of interest.
Defines the method used to calculate the prevalence rate for a domain.
Provides an estimate of the number of individuals with the characteristic of interest in a domain.
Indicates the error associated with the sampling process in estimation.
Indicates the reliability of the estimate of the number of individuals with the characteristic of interest.
Utilizes analysis weights to calculate more accurate estimates.
Employs indicator variables to define conditions in the estimation process.
Uses probability sampling methods to reduce and estimate sampling error.
